entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 2:23AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT SNOW PRODUCING SLICK TRAVEL FOR SIERRA PASSES FRIDAY MORNING... A weak storm system will move quickly across the Sierra and northeast California through Friday, bringing gusty southwest winds and a period of snow capable of producing travel impacts and delays across Sierra crest passes for the Friday morning commute.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 06 at 12:16PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Water levels rising on creeks and streams in Inyo County... Snowmelt in the southern Sierra Nevada of Inyo will start to accelerate with the onset of warmer temperatures. Creeks, streams and rivers will beginning experiencing higher flows that will likely continue for weeks. As creeks swell, some campgrounds will be at risk of flooding. Roads

Relative humidity is expected to decrease to around 20 percent during this time, while northwest winds increase to 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. These conditions could aid fire spread if ignition occurs.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:19AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS THIS AFTERNOON... An anomalously dry airmass for early April will settle over the region today. As temperatures rise into the mid to upper 50s this afternoon, minimum relative humidities will drop to 20 to 30 percent. This combined with northwest winds gusts from 25 to 30 mph will result in elevated fire weather concerns this afternoon.

entry.summary: ...Foothills flooding possible due to rapid snowmelt... Much warmer temperatures from Friday through Tuesday will increase snowmelt over area foothills.
